result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon C Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Corrected 09-23-2016 deleting duplicate credit per DOC notice
Consecutive to: revocation

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must undergo psychological evaluation and follow through with recommendations. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must be compliant with all child support obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's
Preliminary hearing on November 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Brandon C Hall in court with attorney Jamie McClendon.  Defendant Brandon C Hall in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
